summary: Congress responded to Russia's invasion of Ukraine with funding of about $176 billion for U.S. agencies to provide arms to Ukraine, aid civilians, impose sanctions, and more. Most of these funds were for the U.S. response to the Ukraine crisis; some were specified for other purposes. For example, the State Department also responded to other humanitarian crises. This Q&A report examines the status of the...
title: Ukraine: Status and Use of Supplemental U.S. Funding, as of First Quarter, Fiscal Year 2024
